JobFullDesc: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense (RMD), you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers. We are seeking Systems Engineering professionals in the Integrated Fire Control Systems (IFCS) department at our St. Petersburg, Florida location. The department leads all aspects of Systems Engineering that drive the development of complex systems to support RMD’s Land Warfare and Air Defense (LWAD) and Naval Power (NP) mission areas from our Tewksbury MA, Andover MA, and St. Petersburg FL locations.  The IFCS department supports RMD by cultivating a world-class group of systems thinkers who work together as a team to architect technical solutions to some of the world’s toughest challenges. Key technical domains include Radar Systems and Sensor Netting, Effector Systems, Battle Management, Command and Control, Communications, Network Design, Battlespace Integration and Interoperability for Domestic and International customers.Job Summary: The System Design & Architecture (SD&A) Directorate is the central focus for Mission Systems Integration activities within RMD, responsible for defining customer needs, functional and product architecture, requirements definition and decomposition, Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) and System Security Engineering (SSE). We are responsible for system performance for complex, large scale defense applications. Within this directorate, the IFCS employees provide modeling and simulation, system effectiveness, operational analysis, radar systems design and integration, algorithm development, tracking, and discrimination. SDA's Core capabilities encompass a wide range of the key systems engineering competencies required for successful technical development and program execution. Our capabilities cover the entire lifecycle, including business capture, proposal development, system requirements and technical design, as well as system integration and test support. Areas of expertise are radar, sensor, battle management solutions, command and control, and cyber security.The selected applicant will join a team of talented engineers in developing sophisticated naval and maritime solutions in support of the Cooperative Engagement Capability (CEC) program as part of Advanced Networking Solutions (ANS). The U.S. Navy’s Cooperative Engagement Capability (CEC), a real-time ‘sensor-netting’ system that brings together radar data into a single integrated air picture from geographically dispersed ships, aircraft, and ground-based units. This integrated picture improves a battlegroup’s effectiveness by enabling longer range, cooperative, or layered engagements. Today’s CEC benefits from advancements in commercial and specialized technologies, as well as from the experience and expertise of the Raytheon team, continually innovating to advance capability and performance.Responsibilities to Anticipate: Work in a dynamic organization developing customized communications architecture solutions for Patriot Weapons System partners around the globe.Understand the needs of the customer and to put together and implement a comprehensive plan to meet that needModify existing hardware or developing new hardware for a specific missionWork on concept development, preliminary and detailed designs all while implementing those designs in the Communication lab to prove they function as designedWork extensively with the other Engineering Organizations to deliver a superior product to the WarfighterQualifications You Must Have: Bachelor’s in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM). An advanced degree in a related field may be substituted for additional years of experience as follows: An Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 3 years experience. Location details:The position is based in St. Petersburg, FL, enviably nicknamed “The Sunshine City” for its average of 248 days of sunshine a year. The area is ideal for fishing, boating, and beautiful top rated Gulf beaches. It’s also known for its art and culture scene, as well as its wide variety of local restaurants and bars. For sports fans, The Tampa Bay area is home to the Tampa Bay Rays (MLB), Buccaneers (NFL), and Lightning (NHL). It is also the MLB Spring Training site for the Toronto Blue Jays and the Philadelphia Phillies. Our location is easily commutable from several nearby areas, just 5 miles from Interstate 275; options for where to call “home” are plentiful within the Tampa Bay area. St. Petersburg is also close to Tampa International Airport and St. Pete Clearwater International Airport and roughly 90 miles to the Orlando theme parks.
